metadata.title: CVE-2017-0360 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
file_open in Tryton 3.x and 4.x through 4.2.2 allows remote authenticatedusers with certain permissions to read arbitrary files via a "same rootname but with a suffix" attack. NOTE: This vulnerability exists because ofan incomplete fix for CVE-2016-1242.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tryton-server - 4.2.1-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tryton-server package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-2').
